info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 29 at 8:21PM CST until January 01 at 5:27PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.2 feet, State Highway J just east of County Road 206 begins to flood near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 17.4 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 19.5 feet early Friday morning. It will fall below flood stage late Friday morning to 11.4 feet and then begin rising early Sunday afternoon. It will then rise again to 11.5 feet early Monday afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 17.6 Wed 8 pm 19.5 16.6 12.3 11.5 11.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
